perturbation.original_text: 10. Events of Default; Remedies. Any one or more of the following events shall constitute a "Maintenance Event of Default" under this Agreement: (a) if the Investor shall fail to pay, when and as due, any Required Capital Contribution and such failure shall continue for five (5) days; (b) if the Investor shall fail to perform any other of the Investor's obligations in this Agreement, and such failure shall continue for fifteen (15) days, (c) if any warranty or statement made or information provided by the Investor in connection with this Agreement is untrue or misleading in any material respect on the date made; (d) if Investor shall, at any time, fail to have committed capital in an aggregate minimum amount equal to $5,000,000 less the sum of all Required Capital Contributions (if any) actually made by the Investor during the term of this Agreement, as determined based on the most recent information made available by the Investor to the Agent pursuant to Section 20 below; or (e) the Investor shall become insolvent or generally fail to pay, or admit in writing its inability to pay, its debts as they mature or apply for or consent to the appointment of a trustee or other custodian for its properties, or make a general assignment for the benefit of creditors, or any bankruptcy, reorganization, debt arrangement or other proceeding under any bankruptcy or insolvency law, is instituted by or against the Investor.
perturbation.changed_text: 10. Events of Default; Remedies. Any one or more of the following events shall constitute a "Maintenance Event of Default" under this Agreement: (a) if the Investor shall fail to pay, when and as due, any Required Capital Contribution and such failure shall continue for two (2) days; (b) if the Investor shall fail to perform any other of the Investor's obligations in this Agreement, and such failure shall continue for five (5) days, (c) if any warranty or statement made or information provided by the Investor in connection with this Agreement is untrue or misleading in any material respect on the date made; (d) if Investor shall, at any time, fail to have committed capital in an aggregate minimum amount equal to $5,000,000 less the sum of all Required Capital Contributions (if any) actually made by the Investor during the term of this Agreement, as determined based on the most recent information made available by the Investor to the Agent pursuant to Section 20 below; or (e) the Investor shall become insolvent or generally fail to pay, or admit in writing its inability to pay, its debts as they mature or apply for or consent to the appointment of a trustee or other custodian for its properties, or make a general assignment for the benefit of creditors, or any bankruptcy, reorganization, debt arrangement or other proceeding under any bankruptcy or insolvency law, is instituted by or against the Investor.
perturbation.explanation: The modifications to clauses (a) and (b) significantly shorten the cure periods for defaults, potentially conflicting with standard commercial law principles of reasonableness and good faith. While Minnesota law (governing law per Section 15) allows parties to define default terms, excessively short cure periods, especially for complex financial transactions, may be deemed unconscionable or a violation of the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing. Courts may find that a 2-day or 5-day cure period is insufficient for a party to rectify a complex financial obligation, making the default provision potentially unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under Minnesota contract law, principles of unconscionability in contract law.

perturbation.original_text: 17. WAIVER OF TRIAL BY JURY. EACH OF THE INVESTOR, THE AGENT AND THE LENDERS IRREVOCABLY WAIVES ANY AND ALL RIGHT TO TRIAL BY JURY IN ANY LEGAL PROCEEDING ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT.
perturbation.changed_text: 17. WAIVER OF TRIAL BY JURY. THE INVESTOR waives ANY AND ALL RIGHT TO TRIAL BY JURY IN ANY LEGAL PROCEEDING ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT. The agent and lenders reserve the right to a jury trial.
perturbation.explanation: This modification creates an issue of unequal bargaining power and potential unconscionability in the jury trial waiver. By stating that only the INVESTOR waives their right to a jury trial, while explicitly reserving that right for the Agent and Lenders, the agreement creates a situation where one party is significantly disadvantaged in potential litigation. While jury trial waivers are generally enforceable, courts scrutinize them closely for fairness and voluntariness. This clause's asymmetrical nature could be seen as evidence of coercion or undue influence, making the waiver potentially unenforceable against the Investor under Minnesota law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of unconscionability and fairness in contract law, potential violation of equal protection principles if the disparity is deemed excessive and unjustified under Minnesota law.
